results.title: How wonderful
results.brief_description: This is a quirky film about Kerry, a modern career woman, who becomes pregnant for the first time. With hormones whizzing around her body and her mind whirling with fantasies, we view the side of pregnancy never seen before - from the expectant mother’s eyes. As she tries to deal with mental, emotional and physical changes, she begins to fantasise about her own capability as a mother, her misogynist obstetrician, over-zealous relatives and a husband in the midst of sympathy toothaches and training for his first marathon race! Cast includes Tracy Mann and Jim Holt.

results.title: How wings are attached to the backs of angels = comment les ailes sont attachees au dos des anges
results.creator_credit: Craig Welch, Marcy Page and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A man’s obsession with control manifests itself in the manipulation of his gadgets and his practice of a science which dissects and reduces. Despite his meticulous nature he is not beyond longing, but has his crimes and fears pushed him beyond redemption? This film provides the viewer with a surreal eleven minute experience.

results.title: How we know the earth moves. - Rev. ed.
results.brief_description: Shows how scientists came to understand that the Earth spins on its axis and that it travels around the Sun. Discusses the contributions made by Copernicus and Foucault, as well as early observations of the movements of constellations. Explains the Foucault pendulum and involves students in a demonstration illustrating star shift. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: How we begin
results.creator_credit: Thora James, Frank Wells and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Physiology of Human Reproduction”.
After discussing external physical differences between the two sexes, the film shows various tuypes of body cells and how cell division takes place in the human embryo after the egg cell has been fertilised.

results.title: How we adapt
results.creator_credit: William Banting, CTV Television Network and Films Incorporated
results.brief_description: Notes the increasing amount of stress and stress-related illness in people’s lives. Emphasises the fact that, like some illnesses, stress may also be psychosomatic and controllable by the adoption of stress management techniques. Suitable for tertiary level.

results.title: How to write & conduct effective performance appraisals. V.3
results.brief_description: Program leader Jimmy Calano provides a seminar presentation to assist managers in developing their staff. Being an effective manager is not just a matter of telling employees how they’re doing. They need to know where they fit in the big picture and how to contribute on a higher level. Learn how to fairly praise and criticise your people in order to inspire renewed commitment to their jobs.

results.title: How to write & conduct effective performance appraisals. V.2
results.brief_description: Program leader Jimmy Calano provides a seminar presentation where we learn the awful truth about performance appraisals - that they are a responsibility for which most of us were never trained. Provides the manager with a proven, ready-to-use performance appraisal system to help your employees progress in their careers!

results.title: How to write & conduct effective performance appraisals. V.1
results.brief_description: Program leader Jimmy Calano, provides a step-by-step seminar presentation where we learn to turn a dreadful task into a motivating tool. Performance appraisals are one of the toughest jobs in management, yet executed properly they are an important way to keep people growing. Some of the skills include how to identify over- and under-performing achievers, eight traditional performance appraisal methods and how to design an appropriate appraisal format.

results.title: How to windsurf
results.brief_description: This video is designed to teach windsurfing in seven lessons. Information on how to assemble the board, how to get underway, steering, tacking, gybing and a section concerning safety are included. The video is designed so that each lesson is self-contained. The lessons are aimed at beginners of any age.
